content: you find yourself in what appears to be the castles prison the King's Guard
flank the cells they are heavily armed behind the rusted iron bars stand the
men you believed to be wrongly convicted for the crime of treason hey guys it's
Friday and that means it's time for another black magic craft build video in
this episode I'm going to continue on my theme of simple items that are
incredibly useful and I'm going to share with you one of my favorite bits of
dungeon dressing modular prison walls these iron bard walls are so useful they
have a home in every single dungeon you can use them for walls doors cages
portcullis whatever you want SuperDuper handy to make it even easier
on you guys I designed a template that you can print out it will help you doing
your cut but more importantly it will help you assemble the bars and keep them
looking good it's actually a really clever idea I think I think you'll enjoy
it the template is pay-what-you-want on drive-thru RPG that means that anyone
can get their hands on it for free if you want to throw me a few bucks when
you download it if maybe you've been wanting to help out the channel but you
don't want to commit to something like patreon this is a great way that you can
just throw a few bucks my way and help me out to keep doing what I do without
further ado let's build some prison walls so this template comes in two
pages the first page is your cut sheet what you're gonna want to glue to some
heavy cardstock so you can use it over and over again and the second page is
your assembly sheet that one you're actually gonna want to just tape to some
cardboard or foam core or whatever just some kind of flat surface for assembly
the walls are constructed out of a mix of popsicle sticks
tongue depressors barbecue skewers and toothpicks and it's ideal if you can get
square kind of toothpicks rather than round ones this will make assembling
them a lot easier as two flat surfaces are gonna glue together much better than
two round ones the bars are going to be constructed out of the toothpicks
including the horizontal ones but you might find that the toothpicks you have
go to a point before the actual length of the template that I've made so if
this is the case for you like it was for me you can cut off the point to the next
appropriate bar and just use that as your length for the walls using the
template you want to cut as many horizontal and vertical bars as you're
gonna need to construct as many walls as you want to construct you're gonna want
to use regular popsicle sticks for the top and bottom plates and again use the
cutting guide to cut as many as you think you're gonna need for the support
rails you're gonna want to use barbecue skewers and these are great because
they're more square than flat cut as many as you're gonna need last the base
of the walls is going to be made out of tongue depressors and unfortunately I
was all out of tongue depressors so I had to stop and make a trip to the
dollar store to grab some well there was no dang tongue depressor extra large
popsicle sticks at the dollar store that sucks so guess I'm driving to Walmart I
don't want to go to Walmart I really don't like Walmart
alright enough of that nonsense let's assemble these prison walls so apologies
for the big arm and the way I didn't pick the best camera angle for this but
basically what you want to do here is take your horizontal bars and using very
small dabs of PVA glue glue them right to this building guide this will keep
them in place as you are assembling the bars and you can just easily remove them
after once that glue has tacked up a bit and those bars aren't going to move you
can then put tiny little dabs of glue on the horizontal bars and drop in place
your vertical bars using the guide using the printout you can line up all these
vertical bars so that they stay nice and evenly spaced and nice and straight the
top and bottom parts of this wall are little u channels that you want to
create by gluing the barbecue skewers to the popsicle sticks and there can be a
lot of variants in the material you have from what I have so the important thing
is to make sure that the space between the two skewers is exactly the width of
your toothpicks so that your prison bar walls will lock in place nicely you may
find that some of the pieces of wood aren't perfectly straight and don't want
to glue together that easily if that's the case just use some clamps to hold
them in place for several minutes while the glue dries you may find that there's
a lot of variance in the length of your pieces and some of the ends aren't lined
up nicely so if that's the case you can just use a rotary tool or some sandpaper
to even everything out
after the glue on the bars is good and dry you can cut them free from the
template just grab a blade and slice them off you might find that there's
some small bits of paper or glue that is stuck to the backside but you can just
shave that off with your knife you can then take two of the U channels and fill
up that u channel with glue and place the bar wall within it make sure that
your section of bars is centered approximately within the U channels then
once the glue has totally dried you can prime them and I sprayed these using a
grey primer and I did this for the same reason I did it on my iron door tutorial
and that's because the grey undercoating will mean that I'll only actually need
one coat of my gunmetal gray metallic after painting everything out in
gunmetal I decided to add a whole bunch of rust to these things and you could do
this just by stippling on some orange paint I did that I showed how to do that
in the last episode but this time around I wanted to test out this effects paint
that I received from acid drop and it's an airbrush paint and I haven't been
able to use that previously but I now own an airbrush so hey let's try it out
I found that it looked pretty good after just one application but I decided to go
back in for a second round and really add more rust to some of the joints on
the iron maybe I went a bit overkill here but hey whatever is just dungeon
dressings and I really just wanted to try out this new texture paint
as usual I finished off the paint job by applying a dark black wash this kind of
muted that rust that I maybe went a little bit too crazy on and gotten all
the nooks and crannies that the paint didn't reach and overall just finish the
piece off these are a really fun afternoon project I made a couple wall
sections just in the span of a few hours you could definitely bang off a whole
bunch of these in one weekend the template and the assembly guide make
this so much easier if you need to pick up any tools or supplies for your own
projects check out black magic craft dot CA there I have my essential equipment
store where I link to all of the stuff that I use and recommend purchasing
through those links helps fund these videos the other way you can help fund
these videos and ensure that I keep making them every single week is by
supporting black magic crafts on patreon those funds are crucial to giving me the
time it takes to produce these videos for the community I'd love to have your
support and I'd really like to have you as the newest member of the black magic
craft fellowship that's it for this week I hope you guys found this video
entertaining informative and most of all inspiring don't forget that you can
download that template the link will be in the video description below it's free
or pay what you want if you want to donate a few bucks to the channel if you
like this video hit that like button and let me know in the comments section
below if you're new to the channel don't forget to hit subscribe and check out my
back catalog of other videos every single Friday I put out a build video
where I make something cool I've got well over a hundred other videos that
you can check out I also do reviews and unboxings on Tuesdays and Wednesdays
sometimes so good luck with your prison walls I will see you guys again next
video Cheers
